Title: (Senior) Engineer, Software Engineering Solutions, Quantum Key Distribution
Description: (Senior) Engineer, Software Engineering Solutions, Quantum Key Distribution   We are seeking a senior software engineer with experience in the domain of Quantum Key Distribution, to join our team in Singapore. The person will be responsible for leading a small team of (PhD student) engineers locally and liaise with the team in Luxembourg. In addition, the incumbent is coordinating local activities and interactions with the local space agency.   PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES   Mentor and lead the development of software as part of the QKD strategy of SES with focus on KMS and QKD enable KMS implementations.    Ensure technical coordination role in Singapore to make sure SES area of responsibilities are represented Direct access and interface to IMDA Coordinate with SpeQtral technical team Start an investigation on cooperation with the student to support the project Prime interface with the SES Luxembourg Quantum Safe team Lead automation and integration activities of multifaced receivers   Lead the software part of the project, namely Automated operation, multi-mission / multi-protocol KMS, Quantum SDN for service key routing and orchestration Manage the interface with SpeQtral / local contractors / Support the local Singapore BD team during customer engagement with respect to technical aspects   COMPETENCIES   Knowledge of Quantum communication and Quantum Security domain, with focus and hands on experience on Quantum Key Distribution and relevant technologies. Knowledge of the following programming languages, C++, Python and/or Java Hands on experience coding simulators/emulators for space components Knowledge of space domain and understanding of deploying non terrestrial software and hardware Knowledge of Embedded Operating systems and real time operating systems. Knowledge of source control systems and specifically usage of Git Knowledge of software development lifecycle best practices   QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE   Master's degree in computer engineering or software engineering or like field (a combination of experience and education will be considered) Minimum 7 years of relevant professional experience in Software Design and Analysis At least 5 years of working experience, with focus on QKD technologies, with focus on non-terrestrial QKD technologies Work in a team and manage the work distribution of team members Knowledge of Agile/SCRUM or any other iterative methodology for software delivery Working on a multicultural environment Knowledge of English is mandatory Open to travelling in case of requirement of the projects involved   SES and its Affiliated Companies are committed to providing fair and equal employment opportunities to all. We are an Equal Opportunity employer and will consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, pregnancy, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, genetic information, protected veteran status, disability, or any other basis protected by local, state, or federal law.   For more information on SES, click here.

Title: .NET Web Application Developer | Contract

The ideal candidate must have excellent problem-solving skills, a passion for clean and efficient code, and the ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver high-quality software solutions. Job Responsibilities Develop, test, and deploy web applications using ASP.NET Core / MVC and C# Design and implement RESTful APIs and integrate third-party services Collaborate with UI/UX designers to create responsive and user-friendly interfaces Optimize application performance, scalability, and security Maintain and enhance existing applications by troubleshooting and fixing bugs Work with databases such as SQL Server or entity framework for data management Participate in code reviews, ensuring adherence to best practices and coding standards Document technical specifications and provide support for deployed applications Stay updated with emerging technologies and recommend improvements Job Qualifications Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or any related field with 2 – 3 years of relevant experience Proficiency in C#, ASP.NET Core/MVC, .NET framework Experience with microservices architecture Knowledge of HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and modern front-end frameworks (e.g., Angular, React, or Vue.js) Experience with SQL Server, LINQ, and entity framework Familiarity with Azure or AWS cloud services is a plus Understanding of Agile/Scrum methodologies Excellent problem-solving, debugging, and analytical skills LOCATION Singapore RECRUITER Carolyn Mendoza +65 6551 5316 carolyn.mendoza@manpower.com.sg

Title: 2026 Customer Support Internship for 2027 Customer Support Representative Graduate Program (Hindi Speaker)  (May 2026)
Description: Join Bloomberg’s Customer Support team as a 2026 Summer Intern to enhance client service and gain experience at the intersection of finance and technology. Your role Here’s what you will be doing: Support financial professionals by helping them access Bloomberg’s tools and data for real-time decision making Work on projects analyzing processes and developing solutions to improve internal workflows and team efficiency Provide outstanding customer service via ticketing system, phone, email, or live chat Identify, investigate, and resolve customer issues using proprietary software Provide login support and connect clients to Bloomberg products and platforms Collaborate with a global team of over 500 professionals supporting clients in more than 15 languages About you The company is looking for: Business proficiency and fluency in English and Hindi Up to 2 years of full-time work experience Strong written and oral communication skills with clear articulation Demonstrated interest in financial markets or technology through education, work, or extracurriculars Exposure to customer support or stakeholder engagement Willingness to learn new technologies and apply new information Excellent attention to detail and ability to work quickly and accurately under pressure Effective multitasking and problem-solving skills; ability to work independently and in a global team Currently enrolled in university with graduation between December 2026 and August 2027 Available for the full 10-week internship from 18 May to 24 July 2026 Training & development Mentorship by experienced Bloomberg Customer Support professionals Training program covering Bloomberg products, services, clients, global financial markets, product setup, hardware, and troubleshooting Opportunities to develop customer service skills and participate in quality control and idea generation projects Career progression Successful interns may be offered a permanent full-time role in Bloomberg Customer Support after graduation Graduate program includes an 8-week training covering Bloomberg products, clients, financial markets, and troubleshooting Involvement in mentoring, recruiting, quality control, and idea generation How to apply This is a two-stage application process. After submitting your main application, you will receive an email with instructions to complete an online assessment, which is required to be considered for the role. Priority may be given to candidates with legal authorization to work full-time in Singapore without sponsorship. This job may close before the stated closing date, you are encouraged to apply as soon as possible
Hiringcriteria: Experience requirement: No experience required; Working rights: Singaporean Citizen; Study fields: Business & Management; Degree types: Bachelor or higher

Title: 2026 Software Engineer Program_Summer Analyst (Singapore)
Description: JOB DESCRIPTION If you're ready to put your passion for technology to work in a way that makes a real difference, you'll find your place in our Software Engineer Internship. JPMorganChase is a global leader in financial services, providing strategic advice and products to the world's most prominent corporations, governments, wealthy individuals and institutional investors. Our first-class business in a first-class way approach to serving clients drives everything we do. We strive to build trusted, long-term partnerships to help our clients achieve their business objectives. When you work at JPMorganChase, you're not just working at a global financial institution. You're an integral part of one of the world's biggest tech companies. Across our global technology centres, our team of more than 63,000 technologists design, build, deploy and run everything from enterprise technology initiatives to big data and mobile solutions, as well as innovations in electronic payments, cybersecurity, machine learning and cloud development. As a firm, we're partnering with FinTech and Silicon Valley tech firms to deliver cutting-edge solutions to our clients and customers. Our $17 billion annual investment in technology enables us to hire people to create innovative solutions that will not only transform the financial services industry, but also change the world. We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. In accordance with applicable law, we make reasonable accommodations for applicants' and employees' religious practices and beliefs, as well as any mental health or physical disability needs. As a Summer Intern in the Software Engineer Program, you will help build and optimize digital applications and systems that support millions of customers, clients, and employees worldwide. The Internship will begin with an induction covering our tech strategies, products, and systems, as well as an overview of our technology community. You will work in an agile team with peers and experienced software engineers to grow your skills, share ideas and innovate with our technology community all over the world. The summer internship will provide opportunity to gain deeper insight into what it means to work here through networking events, senior speaker sessions and peer-mentorship programs. At the end of the summer, top performers may receive the opportunity to join us for a full-time role upon graduation. Join an inspiring and curious team of technologists who will support you in developing new skills, experiencing new projects and businesses, and taking your career where you want to go. Job responsibilities Own projects end-to-end, keeping teams and stakeholders up to speed on the progress of what's being developed. Work and share ideas, information and innovation with our team of technologists from all over the world. Develop through on-going training, mentorship and access to senior leaders. Create innovative solutions that make a difference for our customers, clients, and employees. Work on agile teams with peers and experienced software engineers. Required qualifications, capabilities, and skills Pursuing a bachelor's Degree with expected graduation between September 2026 through August 2027 Available for full time internship from June 2026 to August 2026 Ability to work in large, collaborative teams to achieve organizational goals, with a passion to build an inclusive and innovative culture Demonstrated ability to code in one or more general-purpose programming languages such as Java, Python, Go & other programming languages or technologies like Robotics and Mobile Apps etc. Understanding of software skills such as business analysis, development, maintenance, and software improvement Proficiency in developmental toolsets Basic knowledge of industry-wide technology trends and best practices Exposure to agile methodologies such as CI/CD, Application Resiliency, and Security Familiarity with Big Data or Data Warehousing concepts Preferred qualifications, capabilities, and skillsComputer Science and/or Engineering majors are preferred, while other majors may be considered This program is an opportunity to take your career to the next level through hands on experience, relevant skills training and valuable professional networking. As it is a pipeline for future graduate opportunities, based on individual performance and achievements , those who successfully complete the program may receive offers of full time employment with the firm in 2027 . Holding the permanent right to work in Singapore is an advantage, however, candidates requiring visa sponsorship may still apply Application Deadline: 27 February 2026, 2359 SGT Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis. We strongly encourage you to submit your application as early as possible as there is limited space in the program. What's Next?Help us learn about you by submitting a complete and thoughtful application, which includes your resume and location preference. Your application and resume is a way for us to initially get to know you, so it's important to complete all relevant application questions so we have as much information about you as possible.After you confirm your application, we will review it to determine whether you meet certain required qualifications.If you are advanced to the next step of the process, you'll receive an email invitation to complete a coding challenge powered by HackerRank. This is your opportunity to further bring your resume to life and showcase your experience for our recruiting team and hiring managersHackerRank is required, and your application will not be considered for further review until you have completed this step. We strongly encourage that you apply and complete these required elements as soon as possible, since programs will close as positions are filled. Join Us: At JPMorganChase, we're creating positive change for the communities we serve. We do this by championing your innovative ideas through a supportive culture that helps you every step of the way as you build your career. If you're passionate, curious and ready to make an impact, we're looking for you. About Us: We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. We also make reasonable accommodations for applicants' and employees' religious practices and beliefs, as well as mental health or physical disability needs. Visit our FAQs for more information about requesting an accommodation. ABOUT US J.P. Morgan is a global leader in financial services, providing strategic advice and products to the world's most prominent corporations, governments, wealthy individuals and institutional investors. Our first-class business in a first-class way approach to serving clients drives everything we do. We strive to build trusted, long-term partnerships to help our clients achieve their business objectives. We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. We also make reasonable accommodations for applicants' and employees' religious practices and beliefs, as well as mental health or physical disability needs. Title: [2026 Internship] CAD Software Intern
Description: MediaTek leads the market in chipset technology for Smart TVs, Voice Assistant Devices (VAD), Android tablets, feature phones, Optical and Bluray DVD players, and we're number two globally in mobile phones . You may not know it, but our chips and technology are already likely part of your everyday life. You will find us in 20 percent of homes globally and nearly 1 of every 3 cell phones is powered. As a CAD Software Engineer intern, you will be an active participant in the team responsible for ensuring our CAD flow & methodology is efficient, lean and reliable. You will be involved in developing automation to improve the efficiency and reliability of CAD flow. You can collaborate cross functionally with other teams to deliver on our goals. We will create an individual training plan to help you develop the specific skills and k now ledge required for your role. Microelectronic Engineering students with a strong interest and passion in coding will be a good fit but Computer Science students are also welcomed to apply. [What's in it for you?] • Involve in various stages of the software development lifecycle, including requirements gathering, design and implementation, and deployment. • Develop, improve and maintain CAD flow & methodology for ensuring correct electrical and logical functionality and manufacturability. • Work closely with team members and develop solutions using OpenSource Software technology. • Directly involved in our physical verification methodology efforts, collaborating right alongside our internal multifunctional teams to ensure that our products achieve best in class PPA (Power, Performance & Area) and time to market. [What you will bring] • You are pursuing a degree in Computer, Software or Engineering related studies • You have knowledge in one of the programming languages and are willing to increase skills in this area (Python, Perl, Tcl or JavaScript) • You have a passion in coding and eager to learn • You enjoy collaborating with others to find innovative solutions • You think logically, willing to self learn and research, and take a creative approach to problem solving • You have basic IC design knowledge (this is a plus but not mandatory)

Title: [GRIT] Software Testing Trainee (6 months)
Description: Not Applicable
Roles_&_Responsibilities: The Software Testing Trainee will be responsible for creating and executing test cases, as well as supporting the development and debugging of software. The trainee should have a solid software engineering foundation and be eager to contribute to the quality and reliability of our AI gaming products. Responsibilities Analyze and monitor the performance of Razer’s AI gaming software Develop and execute manual test cases Build and maintain automation scripts Assist in maintaining the quality and stability of Razer’s products Work closely with product, UI/UX, and development teams Learning Objectives The Software Testing Trainee will learn to collaborate with a multidisciplinary team of data scientists, data engineers, and machine learning engineers working on AI-driven gaming software. The trainee will gain hands-on experience across testing, development, and CI/CD phases within a real engineering environment. Lastly, the trainee will be exposed to manual, automation, and performance testing, automation tools such as Robot Framework and Jenkins, software tools including Jira and Confluence and Microsoft Office tools (Word, Excel) Qualifications Diploma or Undergraduate studies in Information Technology, Computer Science, or related fields Excellent verbal and written communication skills Strong problem-solving abilities and high attention to detail Creative, passionate, and innovative mindset with the ability to work independently Proactive, motivated, and a strong team player Programming background (preferably Python) SQL experience is a plus Manual or automation testing experience is a plus Gaming or game development experience is a plus

Title: Actuarial or Data Analyst Intern (Start ASAP)
Description: Actuarial Intern at Aon supporting data analysis, financial modeling, and risk assessment in the insurance industry. Your Role Here’s what you will be doing: Assist in collecting, organizing, and analyzing data for actuarial projects. Support the development and maintenance of actuarial models for pricing, reserving, and forecasting. Participate in preparing reports, presentations, and documentation for internal and external stakeholders. Conduct research on industry trends, regulatory changes, and emerging risks. Collaborate with team members to solve business problems and improve existing processes. Help validate data accuracy and ensure consistency in analyses. Perform other duties as assigned to support the actuarial team. About You The company is looking for: Pursuing a bachelor’s degree in Actuarial Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Finance, or a related field. Proficiency in Microsoft Excel; familiarity with statistical software (e.g., SAS, R, Python) is a plus. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Detail-oriented and able to manage multiple tasks effectively. Interest in pursuing actuarial exams is preferred. Open to students in their penultimate year or first-year applicants. Compensation & Benefits Comprehensive benefits package. Inclusive workforce and agile work environment supporting wellbeing and work/life balance. Two “Global Wellbeing Days” each year. Variety of working style solutions. Equal employment opportunity and accommodations during application or interview process. Training & Development Gain practical experience working with actuarial models and data analysis tools. Develop professional skills in a collaborative team environment. Exposure to the insurance industry and actuarial career paths. Continuous learning culture to inspire and equip you to learn, share, and grow. This job may close before the stated closing date, you are encouraged to apply as soon as possible
Hiringcriteria: Experience requirement: No experience required; Working rights: Singaporean Citizen; Study fields: Business & Management; Degree types: Bachelor or higher

Title: Advisory - Consulting, Forensic (Non-Tech Stream) | Graduate Associate 2026
Description: Job Description  KPMG's Forensic practice consists of experienced professionals with a wealth of experience in investigations, AML/CTF, data analytics, FATCA/CRS, forensic technology and disputes. We have helped some of the world's biggest companies on some of the most important matters of public interest in Singapore.  We help clients deal with:  Fraud, misconduct and corruption investigations Assess and improve client's AML controls and financial crime compliance Commercial disputes Regulatory compliance Managing risk on buying or selling a business, intellectual property and contract governance Preventing and detecting fraud and financial crime We also deploy technology tools to help clients deal effectively with large amounts of data and documentation, to manage and disclose important material or highlight fraud, weaknesses and business opportunities from within corporate data.   Our Associates can expect to:  Gain hands-on experience in Forensic engagements which can range from fact-finding reviews into allegations of fraud and misconduct, assessing AML frameworks and systems, assisting in customer due diligence remediation and backlog reviews for transaction monitoring and screening alerts, and supporting complex investigations through digital forensic procedures and advanced data analytics Grow your network through participation in Forensic practice development with senior management, including drafting proposals, thought leadership and coordinating team building activities Gain insights into the methodology and approach used in conducting Forensic engagements Obtain an understanding of stakeholder management and project delivery Take responsibility in engagement planning and keep senior team members informed of significant developments and progress of the engagement Learn and understand how to build relationships with client contacts and maintain these relationships after the work has been completed  As a Forensic (Non-Tech Stream) Associate, what could my day-to-day tasks look like:   Forensic Investigation and Dispute Advisory   As an Associate in the Investigations and Dispute Advisory service line, your scope of work will include:  Planning investigations with the Engagement Manager Reviewing documents and devices as part of the investigation procedures Preparing for investigative interviews Progressing the investigations with stakeholders (including other internal service lines) and reporting to the Engagement Manager Assisting with drafting of the investigations/expert witness reports and/or findings  Anti Money-Laundering  As an Associate in the AML service line, your scope of work will include:  Assisting in AML projects which can range from assessing AML frameworks and systems, assisting in customer due diligence remediation and backlog reviews for transaction monitoring and screening alerts, performing Enterprise Wide Risk Assessments and designing AML frameworks Performing sample testing and assisting in the preparation of deliverables to clients with minimal guidance, as part of the project delivery Participating in effort to grow the AML service line together with Senior Management Maintaining awareness with AML and other regulatory requirements affecting the financial services industry  Skills & Background   What skills & backgrounds we are looking for:  Our diverse team is built of people from professional backgrounds including accounting, law, economics, computer science and data analytics.  We are looking for individuals who possess:  Undergraduate degrees with excellent academic records, in accounting or business-related degrees. Analytical skills to quickly synthesise quantitative and qualitative data and interpret it into meaningful insights. Strong attention to detail - Forensic is about finding the needle in the haystack! You should be comfortable with dealing with complex and sometimes imperfect data, to draw credible findings. Strong communication skills. You should be comfortable presenting your findings to your colleagues and clients in an interactive manner, both orally and in writing. Demonstrated ability to work in a cohesive team environment and be able to collaborate with a wide range of personalities. Time management skills. It is not uncommon to work on 2-3 projects at the same time. You should be able to understand priorities, be confident enough to clarify the priorities from senior team members and raise concerns if these are not achievable. A continuous desire to learn and grow. Forensic is always evolving, and we adapt to these changes. While you are expected to learn through research and experience, KPMG will provide opportunities to support your desire to learn and grow. Willing to participate in practice growth and development initiatives. Prior internship experience in areas related to Audit, AML, Forensic Accounting, Fraud & Financial Investigations, Business Intelligence, Internal Audit and Compliance would be an advantage but not essential Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted by KPMG Talent Acquisition team, personal data collected will be used for recruitment purposes only. At KPMG in Singapore we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace. We believe that diversity of thought, background and experience strengthens relationships and delivers meaningful benefits to our people, our clients and communities. As an equal opportunity employer, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of age, race, gender identity or expression, colour, marital status, religion, sexual orientation, disability, or other non-merit factors. We celebrate the different talents that our people bring and support every staff member in their journey to achieve personal and professional growth. One of the ways we do this is through Take Charge: Flexi-work, our flexible working framework which enables agile and innovative teams to help deliver our business goals. Title: AI Engineer Intern
Description: Company CPO Pte Ltd dndts.com Designation AI Engineer Intern Date Listed 19 Dec 2025 Job Type Entry Level / Junior Executive, Experienced / Senior Executive Intern/TS Job Period Immediate Start, For At Least 6 Months Profession Engineering Industry Logistics Location Name 115 Airport Cargo Road, Singapore Address 115 Airport Cargo Rd, Singapore 819466 Map Allowance / Remuneration $1,250 - 1,700 monthly Company Profile At CPO PTE. LTD., we believe that data is the foundation of intelligent business decisions. Our mission is to help organizations unlock the full potential of their data through advanced analytics, transforming raw information into strategic insights that drive growth and innovation. Founded in Singapore, we've grown to become a trusted partner for businesses across various industries, providing tailored data solutions that address specific challenges and opportunities. Our team of data scientists, analysts, and industry experts combines technical expertise with business acumen to deliver results that matter. We're committed to staying at the forefront of analytics technology, constantly evolving our approaches to provide the most effective solutions. Beyond our technical capabilities, we pride ourselves on building lasting relationships with our clients, understanding their unique needs, and growing alongside them as trusted advisors in their data journey. Job Description AI Engineer Intern Location: Singapore • Type: Full-time, On-site About the Role We're looking for an AI Engineer Intern to help identify, prototype, and deploy AI-driven solutions across the company. You'll work with teams such as e-commerce, operations, and analytics to discover where machine learning, LLMs, and automation can meaningfully improve workflows and decision-making. This role focuses on applied AI, not traditional web or QA engineering. ResponsibilitiesIdentify business problems that can be improved with AI or machine learningPrototype and build AI-powered tools (e.g. LLM-based assistants, classifiers, recommendation systems, workflow automations)Develop and evaluate machine learning models or AI pipelines using real company dataIntegrate AI solutions into existing systems via APIs or internal toolsExperiment with prompt Title: AI Engineer Intern
Description: AI Engineer Intern Date: 15 Jan 2026 Location: Singapore, Singapore Company: Singtel Group Powering the Future with AIDA To lead the next phase of our AI evolution, we've launched a new business unit AIDA – Artificial Intelligence & Data Analytics – a strategic engine driving our transformation designed to scale our AI ambitions with precision and purpose. This marks a pivotal shift in how we operate, innovate, and serve to embed intelligence into every layer of our business. At Singtel, this is more than a technology upgrade. It's a strategic transformation that redefines how value is created across the enterprise core— augmenting human capabilities and unlocking entirely new potential. It is a transformation journey by aligning people, platforms, and processes under one cohesive strategy. Our mission is to build AI literacy, and foster a culture where intelligence empowers people. We welcome you to join us on a transformational journey that's reshaping the telecommunications industry — and redefining what's possible with AI at its core. Grow with us in a workplace that champions innovation, embraces agility, and puts human potential at the heart of everything we do. Be a Part of Something BIG! The AI Engineer Intern will support the development, testing, and experimentation of next-generation AI solutions within AIDA, including Singtel's pioneering AI innovations. The intern will engage in hands-on prototyping ("vibe coding"), explore new AI/GenAI tools, and assist engineers in building lightweight workflows, models, and applications. This role offers a unique opportunity to gain practical exposure to AI engineering, rapid experimentation, and enterprise AI product development while contributing to real initiatives that shape how employees interact with AI across Singtel. Make an Impact by: Support the development and prototyping of new AI and GenAI concepts, including early versions of the AI Avatar and related features. Explore, evaluate, and experiment with AI tools, libraries, frameworks, and agentic AI capabilities to test feasibility and potential value. Assist AI engineers with data preparation, prompt experimentation, model testing, and integration validation. Act as an early-stage tester for new AI solutions to identify bugs, usability issues, and improvement opportunities. Contribute to building lightweight scripts, workflows, or applications to demonstrate concepts and accelerate iteration. Document findings, experiment results, and technical learnings to support engineering refinement and decision-making. Collaborate with solution architects and AI engineers to understand requirements and contribute to iterative development. Skills for Success: Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Data, AI/ML or related field.Master's degree in AI, Tech Management, or Business Analytics. Undergraduate degree in progress (Computer Science, Engineering, AI/ML, Data Science, or related fields). Prior internship or project experience in AI, GenAI, or software development. Basic Python programming skills. Familiarity with notebooks, APIs, or ML libraries. Understanding of prompt engineering basics. Ability to explore and test AI tools and frameworks. Exposure to LangChain/LangGraph or agentic AI tools. Experience building lightweight apps or scripts. Knowledge of cloud or container tools. Curious, proactive learner with strong analytical thinking. Comfortable with hands-on experimentation and rapid iteration. Good communication and documentation habits. Collaborative mindset when working with engineers. Interest in user experience or product thinking. Are you ready to say hello to BIG Possibilities? Take the leap with Singtel to unlock new opportunities and accelerate your growth. Apply now and start your empowering career!

Title: AI Engineering Undergraduate Intern
Description: AI Engineering Intern — CTO AI Centre of Excellence (AI COE) At Dell Technologies, we are always looking for the next generation of innovative thinkers to drive our business forward. As an intern, you will have the opportunity to work on meaningful projects, partner with professionals across the globe while gaining knowledge about our business. At Dell, you are encouraged to be yourself, you will find a culture where differences are celebrated, and diverse ideas are heard and respected. Our mission is to enable the future generation of professionals to create strong networks, achieve critical experiences, and develop core skills that position you for career success. Join us to do the best work of your career and make a profound social impact as a Undergraduate Intern on our Global CTO Team in Singapore. What you’ll achieveAs an Intern Undergraduate, you will gain hands‑on experience with agentic AI and on‑device intelligence on production‑class client platforms.Mentorship from a global CTO engineering team and exposure to customer‑facing POCs in APJ. You will: Build AI assistants that run primarily on device (CPU/GPU/NPU) to improve everyday computer user productivity—design intents include privacy, latency, and power efficiency. Implement agentic workflows (tools, memory, planning) and integrate model APIs to enable autonomous, context‑aware assistance within desktop apps. Develop desktop client features in WPF (.NET) or Electron (JavaScript/TypeScript); contribute UI/UX and instrumentation for real‑world usage. Build or extend backend services that orchestrate models, manage data flows, and support hybrid client–edge–cloud patterns. Evaluate models and experiences; run experiments; profile performance and perf/W; document findings and recommendations. Collaborate with senior engineers and researchers across the global CTO team to deliver proofs‑of‑concept and lighthouse use cases on AI PCs Take the first step towards your dream careerEvery Dell Technologies team member brings something unique to the table. Here’s what we are looking for with this role: Essential Requirements Students (Bachelor’s) in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Electrical/Computer Engineering, Data Science, or related fields who are excited to build practical AI assistants and ship usable software. Experience in WPF application development or Electron app development. Some experience in backend development (e.g., building APIs, services, or microservices). Desirable Requirements Exposure to AI models and agentic model integrations at the API level (e.g., inference APIs, tool‑calling, prompt orchestration). Familiarity with on‑device AI concepts for AI PCs and hybrid client–edge–cloud pipelines (latency, privacy, perf, NPU/GPU acceleration). Working knowledge of C#/.NET (for WPF) or JavaScript/TypeScript (for Electron); Python for prototyping. Comfort with experiment design, telemetry, and performance profiling. Who we are We believe that each of us has the power to make an impact. That’s why we put our team members at the center of everything we do. If you’re looking for an opportunity to grow your career with some of the best minds and most advanced tech in the industry, we’re looking for you. Dell Technologies is a unique family of businesses that helps individuals and organizations transform how they work, live and play. Join us to build a future that works for everyone because Progress Takes All of Us. Application closing date: 31 March 2026 Dell Technologies is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. Read the full Equal Employment Opportunity Policy here. Job ID:R273262

Title: AI Software Development Intern
Description: Company Mikomiko Pte. Ltd. mikomiko.ai Designation AI Software Development Intern Date Listed 05 Nov 2025 Job Type Entry Level / Junior Executive Part/TempIntern/TS Job Period Flexible Start, For At Least 3 Months Profession Sciences / Laboratory / R&D Industry Computer and IT Location Name 85 Science Park Drive, Singapore Address 85 Science Park Dr, Singapore Science Park 1, Singapore 118259 Map Allowance / Remuneration $800 - 1,200 monthly Company Profile At Mikomiko, we are at the forefront of AI Technology and AI Solution development and deployment. Our expertise spans across machine learning, deep learning, multi-model learning, transformer, NLP, frontend, backend, cloud and embedded software development, to focus on AI Generated Content (AIGC) generation and beyond. Join us in shaping the future of AI and revolutionizing industries through innovation and advanced technology. Job Description The AI Intern attached under AI Software Development will be involved in AI software and Social Media platform development, integration and testing, frontend and backend development for AI product and AI platform, where AIGC, machine learning (ML), deep learning (DL), computer vision, speech processing, NLP, cloud deployment, 3D applications, iOS development, computer graphics and their combination might be used. You will play a central role in designing, building, deploying, and scaling cutting-edge digital experiences that bridge traditional and immersive platforms. As an Intern in AI Software Development, you will be responsible to: a) Web Development: o Design and develop responsive web interfaces using HTML, CSS, JavaScript (React, Vue, or similar). o Ensure performance, scalability, and accessibility of web applications. b) Backend Development: o Architect and maintain APIs and backend services using Node.js, Firebase, or similar frameworks. o Integrate databases (SQL/NoSQL) and ensure efficient data flow and security. c) Cloud Deployment & DevOps: o Deploy and manage applications in cloud environments (AWS, Azure, GCP). o Set up CI/CD pipelines, containerization (Docker), and infrastructure as code (Terraform, CloudFormation). d) 3D Development: o Develop and integrate 3D experiences using WebGL, Three.js, Unity, or Blender. o Optimize 3D assets for performance across platforms. e) iOS Development: o Build and maintain native iOS apps using Swift/Objective-C. o Ensure seamless integration with backend services and APIs. Additional Responsibilities: ● Collaborate closely with AI developers to design UI, integrate AI models, and test AI systems (using Docker) for commercial applications, or to improve existing products ● Participate in full-stack development for Web and Mobile platforms. ● Assist with system integration, cloud deployment, and DevOps operations, including continuous testing and evaluation to improve system performance. Job Requirements ● Programming skills with experience in GUI design and implementation, frontend and backend development, and cloud/server system design and integration in the use of programming languages such as C/C++, Python, Java, Javascript/Typescript, Swift programming, C#, web related programming; familiar with Database, React, NextJS, Nodejs, Docker, embedded software development ● Strong backend programming experience with RESTful API design. ● Proficiency with front-end frameworks (React, Angular, or Vue). ● Solid experience with cloud platforms and modern deployment workflows. ● Familiarity with 3D rendering and asset integration in web/mobile environments. ● Deep knowledge of iOS development lifecycle and app store guidelines. ● Comfortable with Git, Agile methodologies, and collaboration tools (Jira, Slack, etc.) ● Few months of project experience across the relevant domains. ● Ability to quickly develop expertise in new domains and products, and eagerness to master new challenges. ● Strong communication and collaborative abilities along with analytical and problem, solving skills Additional Advantages: ● Experience with cross-platform frameworks. ● Exposure to large deep learning model technologies. ● Familiarity with practical industry use case. Benefits: ● Gain hands-on experience in a leading AI company at the forefront of technological advancements. ● Work closely with a diverse team of experts and professionals in the AI industry. ● Opportunity to showcase your skills and potentially secure a future career with the company. ● Official annual leaves and medical leaves given. ● Potential for performance-based incentives and awards, or opportunity to be converted into full time staff. Application Instructions Please apply for this position by submitting your text CV using InternSG. Kindly note that only shortlisted candidates will be notified. Apply for this position

Title: AIML Software Engineer Intern
Description: Note: For interested applicants, please apply through the FILPAL Website by clicking the link below to complete and submit your application. Thank you! Link：https://www.filpal.com/career Job Summary: Assist in the development and implementation of AI models focusing on Convolutional Neural Network (CNN)-based detection algorithms to enhance object detection and classification, and Reinforcement Learning (RL)-based algorithms for RF design optimization. The intern will work under supervision to integrate AI solutions into existing software frameworks, process RF data, and contribute to simulation and testing efforts. This role is ideal for a student from the Applied Artificial Intelligence course at SIT Singapore, providing hands-on experience in AI applications for real-world RF systems. Key Responsibilities: Implement and fine-tune YOLO-based object detection models for analyzing RF signals and spectrograms. Collaborate with the development team to integrate AI models into Python-based back-end components, using libraries such as OpenCV, TensorFlow, or PyTorch. Assist in data preprocessing, including handling I/Q data, signal features, and simulation outputs. Participate in testing and validation of AI models using performance evaluation metrics like accuracy, precision, and recall. Participate in design optimization with reinforcement learning. Contribute to agile discussions, code reviews, and documentation of AI workflows. Explore enhancements to YOLO for real-time detection in noisy RF environments, such as adapting to multipath interference or signal fading. Support integration with existing RFDF tools, including databases (SQL/NoSQL) and visualization interfaces. Qualifications: Current enrollment in the Applied Artificial Intelligence course or equivalent AI-focused program. Basic understanding of machine learning concepts, with exposure to computer vision and decision making. Basic understanding of mathematical optimization algorithm such as GA, PSO, gradient descent or random search. Familiarity with programming in Python; experience with AI frameworks like PyTorch, or TensorFlow is desirable. Strong problem-solving skills and ability to learn independently in a technical environment. Good communication skills for team collaboration and reporting progress. Interest in RF systems, signal processing, or drone technology is a plus, but not mandatory. Skillsets: Basic proficiency in Python programming and data handling (e.g., NumPy, Pandas). Understanding of object detection models, particularly YOLO variants. Familiarity with decision making RL algorithms is a plus. Familiarity with version control using Git is a plus. Ability to work with datasets for training and evaluating AI models. Strong analytical mindset for debugging and optimizing AI performance. Optional Skillsets: Experience with signal processing libraries or RF simulation tools (Ansys HFSS, CST Studio, Keysight ADS). Knowledge of computer vision techniques for spectrogram analysis. Nvidia Jetson embedded system programming. Ability to prioritize tasks and manage time effectively in a project setting. Familiarity with agile methodologies or collaborative tools like GitLab. Job Type: Internship Pay: From $2,500.00 per month Benefits: Flexible schedule Parental leave Professional development Promotion to permanent employee Education: Bachelor's or equivalent (Preferred) Location: Singapore (Preferred) Willingness to travel: 25% (Preferred) Work Location: In person
Benefits: Professional development; Professional development assistance; Parental leave; Promotion to permanent employee; Parental leave support; Flexible schedule; Performance evaluation

Title: Aon Graduate Programme 2026, Singapore - Innovation & Analytics, Business and Data Analyst
Description: Aon Graduate Programme 2026 - Innovation & Analytics, Business and Data Analyst    Aon is in the business of better decisions   At Aon, we shape decisions for the better to protect and enrich the lives of people around the world.   As an organization, we are united through trust as one inclusive team and we are passionate about helping our colleagues and clients succeed.   In this two year programme, you will be exposed to all aspects of our business through four job rotations (6-month cycle) across different business areas, participate in Agile scrum-based projects and have the opportunity to work with key stakeholders across the Aon business, gaining knowledge and insight into our world of data and analytics.   Graduates will be placed in various areas of the business and will have the opportunity to explore risk management and data analytics during the course of the programme   Business and Data Analyst  What the day will look like  In this role, you will partner with diverse teams to bridge business needs and data-driven insights, supporting both strategic decision-making and the delivery of impactful analytics solutions across Aon's organization.   Skills and experience that will lead to success    Fresh graduates who are able to commence full-time employment in July 2026.    Ability to extract, transform, and analyze data using SQL and at least one additional programming or data technology (such as Python or Pyspark), with a foundational understanding of databases and data structures. Skilled in engaging with business and technology stakeholders to gather and document requirements, define project or products goals, and ensure solutions meet business objectives. Proficient in using data visualization tools (such as Power BI or Tableau) to present insights clearly and effectively, following design best practices. Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities, with keen attention to detail and the capacity to turn ambiguity into specific, actionable tasks. Awareness of artificial intelligence and machine learning concepts, including exposure to Large Language Models (LLMs) and/or Generative AI, and a willingness to expand this knowledge. Understanding of Agile methodologies, like Scrum or Kanban, and collaborating in cross-functional teams. Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, including the ability to explain technical findings to non-technical audiences in a clear and engaging manner. Eager to learn and adapt, willing to pick up new skills to support analytics, business analysis, or product development as needed. Able to consider and discuss the ethical implications of data and technology decisions. Proficient in MS Office Suite, including Excel, PowerPoint, Word, and Visio.   #Aon #AonUnited #AonAsia #AonGradsAsia #AonEarlyCareersAsia #LifeAtAon   2025-95377

Title: Aon Graduate Programme 2026, Singapore - Regional Health Solutions
Description: Aon Graduate Programme 2026 - Regional Health Solutions   Aon is in the business of better decisions   At Aon, we shape decisions for the better to protect and enrich the lives of people around the world.   As an organization, we are united through trust as one inclusive team and we are passionate about helping our colleagues and clients succeed.   What the Graduate Programme will look like  Aon Health Solutions is a leading provider of innovative health and benefits consulting services, helping organizations design and manage employee health and wellbeing programs. With deep expertise in health strategy, data analytics, benefits design, and regulatory compliance, Aon partners with clients to develop tailored solutions that improve employee health outcomes, manage costs, and enhance workforce engagement.   Carry out a range of project management related functions, through a series of developmental work rotations. While responsibilities may vary to some extent with each rotation, all are contained in the general role statements below:    Assist in achieving business objectives within a team environment through assigned research, policy and project activities allocated during developmental work placements.    Develop and maintain effective and productive working relationships with appropriate external client contacts and other internal Aon clients. Title: APTD Process Technical Specialist (Start ASAP)
Description: Join Micron as a Process Technical Specialist in Advanced Packaging Technology Development, supporting new technology implementation and process improvements in high performance memory packaging. Your role Key responsibilities include: Engage with supervisors and manufacturing groups to support new technology implementation and process improvement activities. Provide process engineering support through data collection, extraction, analysis, and reporting (SWR, process conversion reports). Execute SWR logistics, monitor product line and lot disposition, and assist in project management. Use software systems such as Yield 3, JMP, Micron Central, MAM, SPACE, and GCP for data analysis and process monitoring. Understand SPC charts, graphs, spec limits, and process variations to suggest improvements. Assist process development supervisors in managing Team Level KPIs and maintaining operational procedures and process tools. Support daily tasks including Cpk improvement, material disposition, and engineering job submissions. Perform data mining, advanced data analysis, and support failure analysis measurements. Assist inline inspection and coordinate non-routine metro/RDA inspections on R&D experiments. Support process operations, process characterization, and new process system setups (SPACE/FDC/LMS/GerM). Manage TOPO, set up process GDM, GCP, SWR, and new SPC charts for process evaluation. Monitor key inline/probe/final parametric indices and initiate first-level investigations for deviations. Contribute to activities and projects improving APTD process procedures, systems/tools, capability, yield, and quality. Work shifts if needed, multitask with proper documentation, and work independently with minimal supervision. About you The company is looking for: Diploma in Electrical, Electronics, Materials Engineering, or equivalent experience preferred. Familiarity with Microsoft Office applications. Good communication and interpersonal skills with interest in a multifaceted environment. Basic computer scripting skills (Python, SQL, Visual Basic) are advantageous; experience in Tableau preferred. Prior semiconductor experience preferred; fresh graduates are welcome to apply. How to apply To request assistance with the application process or for reasonable accommodations, contact hrsupport_sg@micron.com. This job may close before the stated closing date, you are encouraged to apply as soon as possible
Hiringcriteria: Experience requirement: No experience required; Working rights: Singaporean Citizen; Study fields: Engineering & Mathematics; Degree types: Diploma or higher
